intro: Mystacidium costatum, commonly known as the serrated liverwort, is a small, terrestrial liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its leafy, thalloid structure with a distinctive serrated margin along the leaf edges. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually arranged in a spiral pattern and possess a waxy surface that aids in water retention. Mystacidium costatum plays a role in soil stabilization and serves as a microhabitat for various invertebrates.
